content.description: A great line that should get done more often! Enjoyable face climbing on sloping rails and crimps. Low crux with sustained climbing to the anchors. A couple of the pins placed by Gene on the FA have been replaced but all are in decent condition. Possible to find some micro cam placements as well.
content.protection: 1 bolt and a handful of pitons. Is possible to back up some of the older pins with small tcu’s, but not required.
content.location: Start below the bolt on the right side of the face. Follow the obvious seam up and left, then head straight up to find the chains.

content.description: Clam Shell is the obvious wall slightly south of Seashell. This "Face" more or less is between Seashell and Gnomon. There are a few lines on this formation most who pass under it on their way to Moonlight Ridge will notice the Pitons. I believe most routes were done by Paul Muehl and Gene Larson.
